> There was a nod from LORD ELDER, "So you are becoming much like any of
=
> us now." He patted WHEELIE on the shoulder in a hopefully comforting
> ge=
sture, "You are growing tired of the war."
> 
> He smiled in a companiable =
way, "That is good. There are others who
> seem to live for battle, even wh=
en they say they are looking for
> peace." A sorrowful looked passed over E=
LDER's face, "Keep this
> feeling, treasure it. Try to use it to keep you g=
oing, so that as you
> fight this war you do not loose focus of your goal -=
 peace."
> 

Wheelie shrugged quietly, "Live for battle, die for prattle.  =
It matters not when we live or die, just that someone remember why.  In the=
 clouds where we go, another shall pass, don't you know?  If not us, someda=
y along someone else will die.  Will there be anyone else to remember why?"=


Wheelie shrugged, "War is all I shall ever know.  To the next one we will=
e ventually go.  This fighting in the past, shall not end things, for this =
alas.  If to back home we might go, the fighting shall continue again, we b=
oth know.  It is oru fate, it is what we do.  We shall fight, we shall die,=
 and it shall be forever..  Why?  It is all taht we can do.  Ready to kill,=
 you know it is as I do."

He sighed, "I wish only to survive..  But with w=
hat we are..  Can we stay alive?"
